sentence.idiomatic: Yesterday she cooked an entire table of delicious dishes--I stuffed myself again.
The food there is both delicious and cheap, you are guaranteed to get stuffed.
I really can't eat any more. Look--I'm totally stuffed!
Today I'm paying--everyone order and eat whatever you like.
He is very generous. Every time we go out to eat he snatches the bill.
I'll treat, you pay the bill--what do you say?
I learn a lot of things about how to be a quality person from her.
You get back what you put in--you can't understand that simple reasoning?
I earn the money, you enjoy it. Would anyone in the world think that was reasonable?
This is the latest style, there is no discount.
At the end of the season, clothing prices get slashed.
Is there any discount on this bag? How much?
Excuse me, are you paying by credit card, or cash?
I didn't bring enough money--can I pay by credit card?
Carrying cash is inconvenient and unsafe. I prefer to pay by credit card.
A lot of girls are competing to become flight attendants.
When it came to paying the bill, everybody was competing to pay.
I saw this first; on what basis are you contending with me?
It's such a small amount of money, don't quibble with him over it.
Since you love him, don't split hairs with him about who is spending what and who is getting what.
She loves to quibble over everything. She even quibbles over who loves who more.
No matter how difficult the matter is, you always will come and help me. You are really a true friend.
In the end, it is you that is a true friend. Everyone else left, only you stayed behind and kept me company.
She is the worst friend. Once she got a boyfriend she ignored us.
Ah, I'm so full. Today's meal was good.
I'm stuffed too. Um, I'm going to the restroom.
Get back here! I know you've gotta be going to pay the bill again. Absolutely no way! Last time we agreed that I would pay.
But this time I invited you. How could a guest pay the bill?
Just who am I to you? Besides, you've paid quite a few times already!
What does it matter? Being happy is the most important thing. Plus, I have a discount card here.
No, I'm definitely buying this time. Otherwise, I'll never eat with you again! Waiter, bill please!
Excuse me, but who needs the bill? Two hundred eighty RMB.
Give me the bill. I'll put it on my card.
Hey, I have cash. Don't use a card.
Don't listen to him. Take my card. That's enough, stop arguing with me. When we go out, it's always you paying. I feel bad about it.
Aw, why would old friends quibble over such a tiny bit of money? Some friend.
That's why you shouldn't be arguing with me. Otherwise you're really denying me face.
OK, OK. You get this one.
Sir, I'm sorry, but your card isn't working.

word.literal: to pay by credit or debit card
